critique: This document pertains to the integration and coordination of electrical facilities between the Bonneville Project and the Grand Coulee Dam Project. It designates the Bonneville Power Administrator as the agent for the sale and distribution of electrical power generated at the Grand Coulee Dam Project, under the supervision of the Secretary of the Interior. The order outlines the responsibilities of the Administrator and the Bureau of Reclamation in constructing, operating, and maintaining transmission lines, scheduling power availability, and marketing the power. It also specifies how receipts from power sales will be managed and allocated. The document reflects a government-led initiative to manage and distribute electrical power, indicating a degree of government intervention in the economy. There is no direct impact on immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. The focus is on federal management of resources, suggesting a leaning towards federal primacy. There is no explicit ideological tilt apparent, as the document focuses on practical resource management. There is a moderate expansion of executive power through delegation of authority to the Secretary of the Interior and the Bonneville Power Administrator.
